news.headline: In expansion push, Home Depot to spend $172 mln in Mexico this year
news.summary: Home Depot will invest 2.86 billion pesos ($172.16 million) in Mexico in 2024 in a bid to expand its market share in the country, the home improvement chain said on Monday.  The company is widening its product offerings, particularly in the furniture, decorations and pets segments, adding in a statement that it aims to open 12 more stores in the next few years to reach 150 total in Mexico.

The company is widening its product offerings, particularly in the furniture, decorations and pets segments, adding in a statement that it aims to open 12 more stores in the next few years to reach 150 total in Mexico.

news.headline: Home Depot On 'Collision Course' With These Market-Leading Stocks
news.summary: Contractors making the kind of bulk purchases common to new construction tend to deal with local suppliers, or with larger companies built by consolidating local suppliers, led by Builders FirstSource and TopBuild.  The big box retailer is scooping up McKinney, Texas-based SRS Distribution, a supplier to roofing, landscaping and swimming pool contractors.  The deal, with a total value of $18.25 billion, is the biggest in Home Depot's 46-year history.
